Joakim - thanks for the reply you confirm what I was thinking. As long as
they test within a single context its all good. Basically that means that
Mocking goes out the window because I will have to dirty the context and
reload. In addition they claim (and I can't disprove) that an in memory DB
isn't viable.

As for Guice - no such luck. I'm here providing technical advice for a few
days, I'm not going to overturn their use of Spring.

Cedric - Junit isn't the problem. They're writing too many integration tests
and not enough Unit Tests. Your tool may be good but its orthogonal to the
problem at hand.

Cheers
Mark Levison
